title: the no10 downing street parties
story: The No Downing Street parties probe has turned into a farcical cop outOur columnist Mark Steel believes the delay in Sue Grays report is pathetic, adding the police announcement that they are also doing their own investigations has been convenientBoris Johnson tucks into a drink Image: AFP via Getty ImagesopinionByMark Steel:,  Jan |comments We all wondered how it was taking Sue Gray so long to establish there was a bloody party.Maybe she was making the report like a tapestry, and was having trouble embroidering a birthday cake. Perhaps it will be released as an opera, so it will cost £ for a ticket to see it. Then we’ll see a chorus of tenors singing “why do you leave us, do not forsake us ” Then the sopranos will reply “We go to Waitrose, to fetch more wine,” in red chfon dresses. Then a booming bass roars cheekily “It’s a workplace meeting”, all in Italian. It’s possible the report has become more complicated because it turns out Prince Andrew was at one of the parties.  Or maybe she can’t finish it because there was a -piece swing band playing in the No bathroom throughout lockdown, and  people re-enacting the Battle of El Alamein in the kitchen, so she has to interview all of them. But now the Met Police have been kind enough to make her job simpler. Because they insist her investigation should leave out anything about the parties. And an investigation is always easieryou don’t have to include anything that you were investigating. To keep the police and the Government happy, her report should go: “On Tuesday it was quite sunny. The end.” Then she can pad it out with  pages of dot-to-dot puzzles and a nice picture of farmyard animals, with suggestions for how to colour them in. The police can make their own lives simpler by applying the same rules to themselves. When they investigate a robbery, they can leave out everything about the robbery from their investigation and they’ll be able to complete their task much more quickly. When the police announced they were investigating the parties, we were told this meant the report might be delayed for several more weeks. That would be convenient. Maybe they’ll keep this going. So next time the report’s about to appear, it will be announced that the Vatican are investigating the parties to see whether they constituted a mortal sin. So the report can’t be published until there’s a pronouncement from the Pope. In any case, the Government’s supporters now say the whole business of parties against the rules is “trivia”. Why are we bothering with wine and cakes, when there’s inflation and a might-be-a-war with Russia   This would make sense,when Johnson was reading out the rules every single day for several months, he’d said: “But don’t bother sticking to any of this. “You can do whatever you like, I’d invite your mates round and spend all day naked mud-wrestlingI was you. Remember – Hands – Face – Cake – Bottle – Conga.” But they insisted we absolutely had to stay alone, while they did the opposite. Andyou were cynical, you might suspect thatthey lie so blatantly about that, maybe it’s possible that they lie about everything  as well. title: tory admits national insurance rise
story: Tory admits National Insurance rise unpopular as Boris Johnson defies calls to axe tax hikeBoris Johnson has been facing a growing Tory revolt over the manesto-busting tax rise, which comes as families face a cost of living crisisForeign Secretary Liz Truss defended the decision to increase National Insurance contributions in April Image: Getty ImagesByLizzy BuchanDeputy Online Political Editor:,  Jan |comments A senior Tory has accepted the rise in National Insurance will be unpopular with voters as Boris Johnson doubled down on the planned hike. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss admitted taxes are never popular as she defended the Governmentaposs plan for a manesto-busting tax rise in April.The Prime Minister has been under pressure from his own backbenchers to ditch plans to for workers, employers and the self-employed to pay .p more in the pound for National Insurance from April  for a year.The £bn a year hike, which was announced last year, will raise cash to tackle Covid backlogs in the NHS and fund social care.But it comes as families face a cost of living crisis, with bills expected to soar when the energy price cap rises.Mr Johnson was reportedly wavering over the decision this week amid fury over the Downing Street partygate saga.But in a joint article with Chancellor Rishi Sunak today, he double down on the plans - despite the pair claiming to be tax-cutting Conservatives and Thatcherites.Reports also suggested that plans to cut VAT on fuel had been abandoned - despite looming rises in energy bills.Ms Truss told the BBC : We are in a very dficult situation. We have spent a lot of money on the Covid crisis, which had public support, whether that was the furlough scheme, whether it was the business support scheme and the reality is we do need to pay this money back.She acknowledged that taxes are never popular but argued that signicant amounts of money spent coping with Covid must be repaid. As soon as possible, we want to be in a position to lower our tax rates, we want to drive economic growth, because ultimately that is what will make our country successful, she said. But we do face a short-term issue, which is that we have spent signicant amounts of money dealing with the Covid crisis that does need to be paid back. But unrest remains among Conservative MPs, with senior backbencher Robert Halfon urging the Government to go back to the drawing board.  He told Sky News that people were facing a real struggle to feed their families and pay for the cost of clothing and the cost of living. Mr Halfon said: I have suggested that the Government looks at windfall taxes on big business, particularly oil companies for example who have been raking it in over the past couple of years, to perhaps increase capital gains tax as well - so that we can raise those funds for the NHS without hitting low-income workers. Labour aposs Lisa Nandy warned itaposs just simply not possible for a lot of people to survivetheir tax burden grows.She urged the Government to rethink the National Insurance rise, adding Labour would come forward with a much fairer taxation system. AskedLabour would repeal the planned tax hike, the Shadow Levelling Up Secretary said: Weaposre hoping that the Government wonapost go ahead with it. Well, look - we wouldnapost bring it in in the first place, let me be absolutely clear with youthere was a Labour government today there would be no rise in National Insurance, people would not be facing the prospect of seeing their incomes squeezed even more. But Paul Johnson, director of the Institute for Fiscal Studies, said the pandemic had given ministers an opportunity to smuggle in a big tax rise needed to cover the long-term ever-growing costs of the NHS. Mr Johnson told Times Radio: Evenwe hadnapost had a pandemic and eventhe Government wasnapost doing anything about social care, they would still have needed a rise of something like this because spending on the NHS is just rising inexorably year on year on year. In a way, my view is that the pandemic has given them an excuse to smuggle in the rather big tax rise that they would have had to do in any case. title: couple baffled after receiving letter
story: Couple baffled after receiving letter saying how they treat their loved dogs is evilKate and Vinny Field, of Leeds, are the owners of two “happy and healthy” dogs and they were left baffled after receiving a letter accusing them of being "evil" for how they treat themHappy and healthy Dobermanns dogs Veronica and Regina Image: Kate Field MEN MEDIAByMellissa DzinziDouglas Patient:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments A couple have been left baffled after receiving a letter accusing them of being evil for not walking their dogs. Kate and Vinny Field, of Leeds, are the owners of two “happy and healthy” Dobermanns Veronica and Regina, Leeds Live reports.The husband and we received a carefully crafted letter calling them “cruel” and “evil” for not taking them on walks despite them having enough exercise. When the pooches joined the family in , Kate used to take them on two walks a day but she was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis in June  meaning she’s unable to take them both on walks alone. Now the pair leave them to run freely in their spacious garden and once a week business owner Vinny takes them to a private field where they run freely for around an hour.Kate, who admitted she was “enraged” when she first got the letter, decided to share it on Facebook to ask the owner of the letter to come and speak with them.The letter reads: “Take yoredogs for a walk you cruel evil people. Big dogs like what you have should be taken for a walk and not just left in a garden to probably paddle in their own faeces. This is from all the local dog owners and other disgusted people. We have reported you.”  Kate recalling how she felt when she first read the letter said: “It really enraged me when I first saw it thinking ‘who do they think they are’. “I would love for them to come forward, I would explain I can’t physically walk them.” Vinny questioned: “Itaposs weird. How long must it have taken to stencil every word, they even spelt the second word wrong but it must have taken some painstaking time. They’ve got so much time on their hands that we haven’t got.” Veronia, nicknamed Ronnie, joined the family in April  at eight months old but sadly, she had been mistreated by the previous owners. She also doesn’t like young children and other dogs meaning Kate would have to take her out for walks when she knew they wouldn’t bump into the kids or dogs. Regina, also known as Reggie, was eight weeks old when the couple brought her home. Kate continued: “We’re quite alright people,you have a problem you can come and speak to us. Whether they actually know us or really don’t know much about the dogs. The dogs get enough exercise, I don’t understand where this has come from or why they sent the letter. “I’m not strong enough to take them out. We’ve got one of the largest gardens in our street,you were to go around and run all the wayand to the side of the house, you’d get a lot of exercise. They also have all the downstairs. “With the dogs we got, most people when they see them they’ll cross the road because they’re so scared of them. It’s like you can’t win. The oldest , she doesn’t like young children or other dogs even though she live with another dog. They’re also very protective. “We’re responsible dog owners, they’re happy, healthy and loved. Whoever sent the letter has no idea. A lot of people have said itaposs a hate letter and to report it to the police. “If they have gone to the RSPCA or other animal charities,they came out to see our dogs, they would say there’s no way they’re mistreated.” Another nonsensical stenciled letter was also sent to someone in Meanwood talking about bombs and Kate suspects it could be the same culprit. title: doctor shares subtle symptom bowel
story: Doctor shares subtle symptom of bowel cancer where early diagnosis could save livesDoctor Belinda Grfiths has shared how persistent but subtle changes to your bowel movements could be a sign of cancer and catching it early could save livesPersistent but subtle changes to your bowel movements could be a sign of cancer, a doctor has claimed Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByHarriet WhiteheadMya BollanTrainee Trends WriterDouglas Patient:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments Persistent but subtle changes to your bowel movements could be a sign of cancer, a doctor has claimed. Over , people are diagnosed with bowel cancer in the UK every single year, according to Bowel Cancer UK.There are a number of signs of the disease andthe cancer is spotted early there are often greater chances of survival.Bowel Cancer UK explained that bowel cancer is a treatable and curable type of the disease especiallydiagnosed early. Unfortunately, survival rates begin to fall as the disease is allowed to develop, reports The Express.Doctor Belinda Grfiths, who does cancer screenings from The Fleet Street Clinic, has outlined a number of signs.  She said: “The symptoms of bowel cancer can be subtle and can often be confused with symptoms of other, less serious illnesses. “It is important to note that the majority of people with these symptoms do not have bowel cancer but symptoms should not be ignored just in case it is.” The GP states: “You should highlight concerns and symptoms which are present for longer than three-weeks to your doctor so they can investigate the cause. “Delaying investigation could result in bowel cancer being diagnosed at a later stage.”  Doctor Belinda said that persistent and unexplained change in bowel habit such as having more frequent bowel movements, constipation, or having looser stools, lasting for longer than six week is a common sign. Bowel Cancer UK says that one in  men and one in  women will be diagnosed with bowel cancer during their letime. The charity says: “If you have any symptoms, don’t be embarrassed and don’t ignore them.”The NHS explains: When you first see a GP, theyaposll ask about your symptoms and whether you have a family history of bowel cancer.According to the health body, your GP may carry out a number of tests.Theyaposll usually carry out a simple examination of your bottom, known as a digital rectal examination , and examine your tummy . There are some known risk factors, though having one or more risk factors doesn’t mean that you will definitely get bowel cancer, however. Although it is very dficult to research the link between diet and cancer, studies have shown certain foods can definitely affect the risk of bowel cancer. Bowel cancer can be targeted with a range of treatments, based on where your cancer is and how far it has spread. The NHS explains the main treatments are:Surgery – the cancerous section of bowel is removed itaposs the most effective way of curing bowel cancer and in many cases is all you need Chemotherapy – where medicine is used to kill cancer cells Radiotherapy – where radiation is used to kill cancer cells Targeted therapies – a newer group of medicines that increases the effectiveness of chemotherapy and prevents the cancer spreading.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSBowel cancerCancer" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: ex detectives high demand talk
story: Exclusive: Ex-detectives in high demand to talk about unsolved crime cases at eventsNetflix murder documentaries have led to a boom in interest in real-le crimes, and former police officers can earn big bucks with public appearances at eventsFormer detective Colin Sutton helped catch killer Levi BellfieldByDan WarburtonNews Reporter:,  Jan |commentsRetired police officers and legal eagles are back on duty, thanks to a boom in true crime fans. Ex-detectives and former criminal QCs and profilers are in demand to appear at events looking at infamous murders and unsolved cases. And with ticket prices regularly ranging from £ to £, it seems that crime really does pay. At CrimeCon UK , audiences will meet a whole host of law enforcement experts from ex-DCI Colin Sutton – who helped snare serial killer Levi Bellfield – to former chief prosecutor Nazir Afzal, who brought the Rochdale child sex gang to justice.Organisers say Netflix, BBC and ITV dramas recounting some of the UK’s most notorious crimes have fuelled a huge surge in public interest. And they believe the two-day event in London in June could shed fresh light on thousands of unsolved murders.  CrimeCon’s Nancy Baughen said: “There is a global rise in crime fascination. It’s driven by armchair sleuths, especially women, and propelled by the popularity of true crime programmes. “There is no other event in the UK that brings fans and followers of this genre closer to leading crime experts.” Forensic psychologist Kerry Daynes, ex-detective Mark Williams-Thomas and BBC Inside Justice’s Louise Shorter are among the names on the bill. As is Marie McCourt, , who fought for Helen’s Law in her murdered daughter’s name to stop killers from being releasedthey refuse to say where they have hidden bodies. title: landlord selling pub after customers
story: Landlord is selling pub after customers left one-star reviews saying hes too grumpyA pub landlord claims he is selling his business after falling out with disgruntled customers who branded him too grumpy and miserable in reviews posted on TripAdvisorAndy Gascoigne behind the bar of The Farmers Arms at Muker Image: Yorkshire Post   SWNSByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterCharlotte Penketh-King:,  Jan |commentsWhen running a business, itaposs fair to say that not everyone is always going to like what you do and thereaposs often not much you can do about it. But one man is clearly fed up of not getting on with his customers and has decided to take drastic action as a result. Andy Gascoigne, , and his we Mandy bought the th century Farmers Arms in Muker in North Yorkshire back in .Sadly, they have decided to sell their quaint country pub after struggling during lockdown and repeatedly falling out with local residents who left one-star reviews on TripAdvisor, branding Andy too grumpy. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Unhappy customers on TripAdvisor complained about Andyaposs unfriendly rudeness, while another described him as a miserable bloke. Pub landlord and ex-squaddie Andy managed to further irk his disgruntled customers by brewing a beer named after his response to them - aposJog Onapos.Sharing a photo of his new beer on the pubaposs Facebook page, he wrote: aposWhy not join us in wishing all the moaners, groaners or folk who just donapost fall into line with the way things are at this moment in time, or is it just our sense of humour!!However, not everyone disliked the beer, with some commenting on the post that it was brilliant and certainly needed. The pub has since gone on the market for offers in the region of £,.Listed on Rightmove by Everard Cole, the Farmers Arms is described as traditional, warm and welcoming.The listing reads: The property is stone built and part rendered under a stone-flagged roof. The property benefits from double glazed windows, mains electricity, water and drainage with oil fired central heating. The internal accommodation consists of a welcoming front door that leads into the open-plan main bar that enjoys a traditional, warm and welcoming feeling and benefits from part flagged floor and a feature recently installed dry stone wall fireplace and new multi-fuel cast iron burner and a separate snug.The bar area is of character having part exposed stone walls and exposed ceiling beams throughout. Customer lavatories both male and female which again have both been fully refurbished to a good standard, two separate beer cellars for cask and keg beer which are cooled and include an automated racking system. Upstairs is a generous fully fitted commercial kitchen with preparation and washing up facilities and an excellent range of commercial catering equipment, walk-in refrigerator and freezers, and a dry goods store. Outside is a small yard area with access to the rear store and a side door out into the skillet which doubles as a fire escape route.The pub also comes with an outside terrace and fully-refurbished owners flat, comprised of a double ensuite bedroom, sitting room, small dining room office second bedroom with a bathroom, as well as a self-catering holiday flat and stone-built barn opposite the property.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: legendary committed daily mirror reporter
story: Legendary and committed Daily Mirror reporter Bill Daniels dies aged During his career Bill Daniels reported on the Birmingham pub bombings where he was among the first journalists to reach the scene and had front page stories on seven consecutive daysBill Daniels was an exemplary reporter for the Daily Mirror for nearly  years Image: Dick WilliamsByAndy LinesChief reporter:,  Jan |commentsLegendary Daily Mirror reporter Bill Daniels has died aged . Daniels spent almost  years with the Mirror working mainly from our Birmingham office. He joined us in  and covered many major stories until his retirement in . During his career he reported on the Birmingham pub bombings where he was among the first journalists to reach the scene and had front page stories on seven consecutive days. He chaperoned the woman at the centre of the Profumo scandal Mandy Rice-Davies when the Mirror did a series on her.  He and we Kay, who predeceased him, even spent nights out with Rice-Davies and Peter Rachmann. Among other stories he covered were the Black Panther trial, the Tracie Andrews murder, the Handsworth riots and he was on the very last voyage of the Ark Royal. Daniels was also part of the Mirror team which successfully brought the  World Cup ball back from Germany to England ahead of the  Euros. Daily Mirror editor Alison Phillips said: Bill was a very much loved and respected member of the Daily Mirror aposfamilyapos.  He worked for us for almost  years and was a great reporter and a lovely man. Son Iain said For Dad journalism, and working for the Daily Mirror, was not simply a job, it was who he was. “He was of the aposold schoolapos - fair, fearless and utterly committed to chasing down the story. Daniels leaves two sons, Iain and Stuart and his beloved five grandchildren Cameron, Samara, Alec, Catriona and Neve. title: mum given misdiagnosed trapped nerve
story: Mum misdiagnosed with trapped nerve left with one working legShannon Turnbull, , from Edinburgh thought her pain was down to a trapped nerve until one side of her body went numb and she was rushed into AE to receive a devastating diagnosisShannon was left in shock when doctors told her she had an incurable condition Image: shannonturnbull_  InstagramByIona YoungHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsA young mum who thought she had a trapped nerve was stunned when doctors revealed it was a le-changing condition leaving her only able to use one leg. Shannon Turnbull, , noticed bizarre symptoms such as a tingling sensation and changes to her vision at the start of the year.But when the left side of her body went numb and she was rushed to AE, she was shocked to learn that she had the degenerative condition, Multiple Sclerosis .The mum of two had initially thought she was suffering from a trapped nerve, but after  hours in hospital was without almost allin her left leg.Speaking to EdinburghLive : Around three and a bit weeks now I started to develop what I could only describe as sensitivity on my skin on my back on the lower left side.  To touch it hurt, to even have my clothes on it would hurt, even the temperature affected this. I thought maybe I’d pulled a muscle, I’m sure it’ll sort itself out. As the days went on it got worse, it was rapidly spreading to my tummy. I still didn’t think much of it and was waiting for it to just disappear. I started to develop extreme numbness on the affected areas and as more days went by it was spreading down my leg. By Monday just gone, my lower left back, tummy and thigh were completely numb. I felt asI’d had an epidural! Sharon, who is a mum to her sons, Tommy and Louis, is now learning to walk again with theof just one leg. She said: I visited my doctor and got some blood tests and referred to a neurologist for an appointment in a couple of weeks. She said to contact themsymptoms got any worse. Tuesday morning I woke up and my leg was extremely weak, the numbness had covered my full leg and I wasn’t able to walk as well. The doctor sent me straight up to AE, where I underwent multiple MRI and brain scans. After spending  hours staying in hospital and almost complete loss of my left legI was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. MS is a lelong condition that affects the brain and nervous system. It is caused by your immune system mistakenly attacking your brain and nerves. Multiple Sclerosis cannot be cured. The moment I was made aware of my diagnosis I knew instantly my le would be changed forever. Within days of her shock diagnosis, Shannon explained her le has already changed dramatically. The family has overhauled their routine and are even having to move to a new home specially adapted to her needs. As well as the physical aspects of the condition, Shannon must now mentally come to terms with her diagnosis, for which there is no cure. She said: Last Saturday I was running around in the soft play with my boys and this Saturday I canapost even walk. Why is le so unfair  The hardest thing to deal with has definitely been the loss of my left leg . Iaposve been walking since I was one and at the age of  Iaposm now having to reteach my leg how to walk again, which is very frustrating and tiring. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The brave mum is now sharing her story on social media to raise awareness of MS. She said: I was honestly so nervous to share my story but I genuinely came to AE thinking I had a pinched nerve. Scotland holds the highest MS rates, I canapost understand why there is such little awareness around this condition. According to the MS Society, there are more than , people with MS in the UK. This makes the condition more common in the UK than in most other countries in the world.You can follow Shannonaposs story here and find out more information about the condition here. title: mum says instinct saved babys
story: Mum says instinct saved babys le after rushing to hospital despite no warning signsJemma Austin claims she had a gut feeling, which she describes as a mothers instinct, that her unborn baby was in trouble and needed medical attention despite showing no warning signsJemma Austin and Paul Jordan when Axel was bornByEmma DunnDouglas Patient:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments A mum has credited her motheraposs instinct for saving her unborn babyaposs le after she rushed to hospital convinced something was wrong despite there being no warning signs. -year-old Jemma Austin had a gut feeling that something wasnapost right when she was  weeks pregnant, Daily Star Sunday reports.And after insisting doctors check her over - they discovered her cervix was open. Jemma had previously lost a baby boy at  weeks in September  and had been worried history was repeating itself. The beauty salon owner and her partner, Paul Jordan, , a scaffolder, had been trying for a baby for five years, suffered two miscarriages, a stillbirth and had gone through two rounds of IVF to fall pregnant through a donor egg. Jemma, from Worcester, West Midlands, told Daily Star Sunday: I was on a walk with the dog and I just had this feeling I should go and see my consultant. I didnapost have any symptoms, but I just knew I should go in.  It was in my gut - I couldnapost ignore it. It was a motheraposs instinct. It was a cervical infection that meant I lost my previous baby, William. Thankfully, I could hold long enough to give this baby a good chance. He was so tiny when he was born. I got to hold him for just a moment before he was taken away. It was so up and down but he pulled through. Heaposs a fighter. We have such a strong bond. Heaposs such a happy little boy. Jemma was kept in Worcestershire Royal Hospital, Worcester, West Midlands, for two weeks until she went into labour at  weeks - she was then rushed to Birmingham Womenaposs Hospital, West Midlands, to give birth. The coupleaposs baby boy, who they named Axel, was born  weeks early on February , , weighing a tiny lb z.He battled sepsis, seizures, necrotising enderocolitis and had to learn to breathe independently until he was able to be discharged and head home on June , .Ever since meeting her partner Paul in February , the pair knew they wanted to have a baby together. After trying since  the couple were delighted to find out they were pregnant in May .  But they lost the baby at  weeks due to an infection in Jemmaaposs cervix. Losing William was awful, she said. I got to hold him in my arms and say goodbye. But after another miscarriage the couple turned to IVF in a bid to have a family together. They decided to go to Brno, Prague, Czech Republic, to try IVF with a donor egg as it cost them less. In September  they flew out and to the couples delight the treatment worked and they fell pregnant.The pregnancy was going smoothly but while on a walk with her dog Jemma had an inkling that she should go and see her doctor.It was lucky she did as they spotted her cervix was open and measuring mm. They asked me why I came in, she said. Was I in any pain  But I just said it was my instinct. Doctors managed to put a cervical stitch in and Jemma stayed on bed rest in Worcestershire Royal Hospital. At  weeks she was sent to Birmingham Womenaposs Hospital, ready for the imminent birth. Jemma managed to hold on until  weeks when she started experiencing contractions. She managed to have a natural birth and got to hold her son, Axel, before he was whisked away to NICU. Both Jemma and Axel battled sepsis after the birth and their baby boy had a seizure in his first week. After  days in hospital Axel came home with his parents on June , . I always worried that we wouldnapost bond but we did straight away, Jemma said. Now Axel is approaching his first birthday and is a happy little boy. Heaposs such a miracle, Jemma said. I feel so lucky to have him. title: new road laws begins long
story: New road laws begins the long overdue death of the driver as king of the roadNew additions to the Highway Code that come into force today afford cyclists more rights when peddling alongside cars and lorries on Britains roadsCyclists are now afforded more rights on the roads Image: Western MailopinionByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Jan |commentsIt has long been very clear to me that driving is a terrible activity and should be discouraged as much as possible. Recently a friend of mine was slowly cycling up the long hill back to his home when a white van raced inches past him. The displaced air of the vehicle caused him to almost topple into the gutter and his heart to pound as he frantically corrected his balance. Understandably enraged, my friend yelled swear words at the rapidly disappearing back license plate as the motor raced up the hill. Suddenly the van came to a screeching halt and the glass and metal barrier that usually separates drivers and cyclists was broken. A man with a beetroot red face and fury in his eyes slammed his boots onto the tarmac, letting out a war cry as he raced towards my two-wheeled pal and flung a foot forwards. It connected with the back of the bike and smashed the rear light.  As little red pieces of plastic sprinkled onto the road below, the righteous driver explained in no-uncertain and spittle-flecked terms that my friend should have been in the bike lane, despite one not existing, and then he should f*** off. Depending on where you sit on the binary ide of drivers and cyclists, you will want this story to finish in one of two ways. Drivers will of course be hoping that the van man properly lands a follow up blow, causing my arrogantly peddling pal to tumble onto the ground to uproarious laughter from the assembled motorists.Cyclists will be hoping that the driver follows in the footsteps of the Reading Road Rage Warrior, whose momentous fall as he vainly chased after a fleeing Lycra-lad was filmed and viewed million times.Whether or not youaposre disappointed to find out that my friend managed to race off to safety, the encounter is one of many which makes clear there is some bad blood between dferent kinds of road users. For the car drivers, the fear of clipping a cyclist as they race through crawling traffic is a sincere and blood pressure raising one. The rage directed towards people peddling two-abreast is just as earnestly felt. For the bike rider, peddling beside a one-tonne hunk of metal on British roads that claimed  cyclistsapos lives and seriously injured , more in  is scary. Unfortunately for those who associate with the former camp, they are in the wrong. Britain used to be a beautul land of rolling green hills, pristine meadows teeming with le and country paths adorned by luscious hedgerows. Since production of the motorcar began in the early th century that beauty has been under constant attack, slowly chipped away in service of the car. Now huge motorways rip through the countryside. Car parks and business zones surround towns gutted of their once vibrant centres. Primary school children are choked by exhaust fumes. As a nation we made a grave mistake when we decided to build our society around personal transport pods rather than building on the early glory of our public transport infrastructure. We didnapost know then that tens of billions of pounds of roads built each decade would not be enough to cope with the staggering demand for motors. We didnapost know then of the catastrophic toll fossil fuels have on the environment. But because the driver feels safe in their metal castle - warm and separate from society and its problems - we bent our country to them. For decades cars and motorists have been the dominant forces on British highways. They are the fastest, the least vulnerable and by far the most plentul. Today the Government has gone some way to right that historic wrong. Changes to the Highway Code that come into force today give power back to the cyclist - a road user who requires a fraction of the tarmac of the driver, is all but emission free and a statistically lower burden on the NHS. The headline change is that cyclists should now ride in the centre of quiet roads, and keep at least . metres away from the kerb edge on busy tracks with fast moving vehicles. They can also ride two-abreast, so long as theyaposre considerate and let motors overtake when itaposs safe to do so, and pass slow or stationary cars either on the right or left. The upshot of this, and a new hierarchy of road users which puts pedestrians and cyclists up the top - as the least dangerous to others - and HGV drivers at the bottom, is greater protection for people on bikes, and more responsibility for those behind the wheel. Whether or not these changes calm the boiling tension between driver and cyclist in the long run, and enshrine what has long been known to be best practice legally, what is clear is that the cleated shoe is now on the other foot. Car drivers have been demoted to secondary citizens on the highways, and cyclists are now kings of the road. And so they should be. title: people least likely vaccinated against
story: People least likely to be vaccinated against Covid and their jobs revealedAround one in five roofers and beauticians have not received the vaccine according to new research into which UK professions are least likely to get the jabHaving your booster jab is still thought to be the best way to protect yourself against new iants Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Jan |comments Millions of Britons have taken steps to protect themselves against coronavirus by getting vaccines - but there are still many who have not had the jab. The jobs where workers are least likely to be fully vaccinated in the UK have been revealed in new statistics. Bar staff, beauticians, roofers and waiters are among the least likely to have taken the vaccine according to the Office of National Statistics.The new figures reveal that just % of people in those roles had their booster jab by the start of the year. The uptake is highest among doctors, nurses and teachers where -% have already been boosted compared to the national average of %, The Sun reports.The third jab, introduced following the outbreak of the Omicron iant, has helped to keep it at bay as Englandaposs R-rate fell to the lowest it has been for nearly a year yesterday. The rate, which measures the number of people infected, was between . and . the UK Health Security Agency estimates. Dr Jenny Harries, UKHSA Chief Executive said: “Once again, we urge everyone who is able to get a booster jab to come forward and do so. It is the best defence we have against this highly transmissible new iant. The new data shows around one in five roofers and beauticians aged - have not received a vaccine. Of those unvaccinated in the UK, one in seven work as bricklayers, security guards, hairdressers or barbers. Other professions with low vaccine uptake included telesales and road construction workers, as well as bar staff. On Saturday, another , new Covid cases were recorded but the figure was down % on the previous week.Deaths, meanwhile, marginally decreased to  from . From February , GPs in the UK will begin issuing antiviral pills created by Pfizer to high-risk patients.Those with weak immune systems, cancer and Downaposs Syndrome will have priority access to the pills available on the NHS from next month.Trials found the drug, named Paxlovid, slashes the risk of getting seriously ill and dying by up to %given after a positive test.  However, the booster jab is still considered to be the best way to reduce your risk of Covid with early research suggesting it pushes efficacy back up to %. Another antiviral pill, molnupiravir, is already being rolled out to people over  in the UK who test positive for Covid and sign up for the Governmentaposs clinical trial.Health Secretary Sajid Javid said the drugs are set to save thousands of lives.He added: “Our pharmaceutical defences are crucial as we learn to live with Covid- and the UK is leading the way, especially when it comes to the use of cutting-edge antivirals.”A new strain of the virus, BA. iant which is an offshoot of Omicron is showing “evidence of a growth advantage” over the dominant strain, according to a new report by the UK Health Security Agency. However, there are just , confirmed cases in the UK so far and scientists claim there are no signs of it making vaccines less effective. title: prince andrew airbrushed public life
story: Exclusive: Prince Andrew airbrushed from public le as portrait ditched by regiments he once ledPrince Andrew was stripped of his  forces titles as he battles a US sex abuse civil case. He denies wrongdoing. After losing his roles, his social media pages were deletedPrince Andrews portrait has been taken down at three HQsBySean Rayment:,  Jan Prince Andrew’s portrait has been taken down by regiments he once led. The move at three HQs is yet another sign of the Duke of York being airbrushed from public le. It follows the decision to strip Andrew of his  forces titles as he battles a US sex abuse civil case. Andrew strongly denies wrongdoing. But after losing his roles, his social media pages were deleted and his section on the royal website edited. A senior defence chief said today: “This is yet more evidence of the duke’s fall from grace.” Sources say pictures and paintings of the duke dressed in military finery have been removed from the officers’ and sergeants’ messes of the Grenadier Guards, the Royal Irish Regiment, The Royal Highland Fusiliers and the Royal Lancers.  He is no longer toasted at regimental dinners and all links with units he once represented have been axed. Our source added: “The duke has been the master of his downfall. “His inability to accept ­sensible advice shows a real sense of detachment.” One member of the Royal Irish Regiment said: “There is enormous relief. His ­association had become an embarrassment.”  Some regiments have also signalled to Buckingham Palace that they want a say in which royal becomes the next colonel in chief. A source said: “This must be a once in a letime event. We want someone who will stay the course.” Regiments have written to serving and former members informing them that Prince Andrew has been stripped of the rank of colonel in chief.  The Grenadier Guards were told the colonelcy had been ed to the Queen “with immediate effect”. The letter, from Lieutenant General Roly Walker, went on: “I am sure you will all offer a personal ‘Three Cheers’ for the Colonel, an appointment She first held in .” He added: “Buckingham Palace have informed me that the Colonelcy, along with the duke’s other titles and affiliations, will be reallocated to another member of the Royal Family, but claried it will not be ed to The Duke of York.”  Once hailed a Falklands war hero, Andrew is being sued in New York by Virginia Giuffre, , for allegedly sexually assaulting her when she was . She claims she was trafficked by billionaire financier Jeffrey Epstein to have sex with the duke. Last week Andrew, , demanded a jury trial. title: prince harry lecture bosses productivity
story: Prince Harry to lecture bosses on productivity at first public gig in monthsPrince Harry will share his thoughts on burn-out in his first public appearance in  months, speaking at an online lecture for US firm BetterUp alongside tennis star Serena WilliamsPrince Harry took five months paternity leave when his daughter Lilibet was born in June  Image: PAByAmy SharpeNews Reporter:,  Jan |commentsPrince Harry is to give a lecture on how to be more productive at work – by having a good rest.The Duke of Sussex, who took five months paternity leave when his daughter Lilibet was born in June, will share his thoughts on burn-out in his first public appearance in  months. A promo for the talk features his photo and the slogan: “Breakthroughs happen when you take a break.”The -year-old prince has made just one podcast since he and we Meghan signed an £million deal with Spoty in December .The streaming giant is now said to be taking the deal “into their own hands” because of the lack of material. The couple also did a deal with Netflix  months ago, for a reported £m.There have been no shows yet. Harry’s online lecture will be available to up to , business people who subscribe to BetterUp, a US firm that helps CEOs. It last year hired the prince as its “chief impact officer”.  He will be joined at the Inner Work Day seminar by tennis champ friend Serena Williams, music star DJ D-Nice and ex-basketball player Pau Gasol. BetterUp says Thursday’s seminar is intended to fuel “personal and professional growth” and will include “interactive well-being workshops”. Harry vowed to become “financially independent” when he and Meghan, , quit their lives as senior royals in  and moved to the US. news uk-news road-cycling-activist-who-snares-"Vigilante cyclist Mikey films drivers using their phonesByAmy SharpeNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments The Sunday Mirror hit the road with a cycling activist who has snared a string of stars – and found a horde of drivers flouting the law. We saw scores on phones, with some emailing, messaging and even watching TikTok videos.Footage was captured by our guide Mike van Erp, a road safety campaigner whose own father was killed by a drink-driver. Since , Mike has reported , drivers including Guy Ritchie and Chris Eubank. Offenders get a police warning letter and in some cases, prosecution, points and bans. I joined Mike – a carer and dad of two – on the afternoon school run in Hyde Park, London.  Mike, who has , followers online, tells us: “I cross the roads on foot, with my kids and a boy with Down’s syndrome I care for, and I notice how many drivers are fiddling on phones. I’m afraid for him and for my own kids.” Seventeen people died in crashes involving drivers distracted by phones in , latest figures show. Mike’s father Coen, , was killed in Harare, Zimbabwe. Dutchman Mike, who grew up there, says: “I rode out there and saw the wrecked car, a mangled heap of dirty metal, my dad’s body in a blanket.  “I am determined to help others not have to experience such a road death and I’ve realised, through many studies, mobile phone use is worse than drink driving, and that the effects of the heavy mental investment in a remote conversation are much stronger than many realise.”Inside a minute of me joining Mike, we see a BMW driver on the phone. Mike’s £ GoPro, attached to his head, catches her using WhatsApp and email.“I think that’s probably gold standard evidence, I’ll submit that one,” he says.  Soon, we catch a -something man on his phone in his Audi. “He was watching a TikTok video,” Mike says. Broadcaster Jeremy Vine cycles by and declares himself a “big fan” of Mike, telling us: “He’s making the world safer. I love this guy.” We see the driver of a Range Rover taking photos, another scrolling through a playlist and three sending messages. Drivers of expensive cars such as Range Rovers and Teslas are common offenders, Mike says. He regularly sees parents messaging while driving kids.  Celebrity offenders Mike identies get him in the news. Film director Ritchie, , was banned for six months after Mike caught him texting. Former boxer Eubank, , got three penalty points after Mike filmed him running a red light while texting. Mike has been attacked, trolled and even threatened with death by other drivers. But he says: “I had a tough upbringing, so physical danger doesn’t give me much fear.”- Follow Mike at Youtube c cyclingmikeyPhones totally banned We ventured out with Mike three days before new Highway Code rules banned drivers using a phone in any circumstance. The rules apply to drivers stuck in traffic and at red lights – and offenders could face six points on their licences and a £ fine. If a driver has passed their test in the two years before the offence, they will lose their licence. The shake-up prioritises cyclists and pedestrians, with motorists advised to use the Dutch Reach to open the vehicle’s door from inside. This means drivers using their furthest hand from the door to open it, as this forces the body to swivel around, helping to see a cyclist, pedestrian or another vehicle coming from behind.  It is also now acceptable for cyclists to ride in the centre of the road, in some situations. And they are not obliged to use the cycle lane. Drivers who are overtaking cyclists must leave at least . metres of space at up to mph, moredriving faster. title: up 500m covid loans given
story: Exclusive: Up to £m in Covid loans given to , companies which later went bustThe shocking sum is on top of the £.billion extracted by fraudsters from the emergency Covid schemes like furlough and Eat Out To Help OutUp to £m in loans was given out Image: Getty ImagesByAndrew Buckwell:,  Jan |commentsUp to £ million in Bounce Back loans were given to companies which then went bust. Almost , businesses have stopped trading or gone into administration after taking taxpayer-funded cash to help them in the pandemic.The staggering sum is on top of the £.billion extracted by fraudsters from the emergency Covid schemes like furlough and Eat Out To Help Out.The new details emerged after the minister for counter-fraud, Lord Agnew, resigned in anger at the Government’s inability to tackle scams. The Insolvency Service said it had identied , companies in England, Wales and Scotland that became insolvent between last May and October after getting a Bounce Back loan.  The bank loans, which were fully guaranteed by the Government, were intended to compensate firms for reduced trade during lockdowns. Bosses could apply for up to £, or % of annual turnover. Banks were ordered to ease the usual checks. Many borrowers self-certied financial status. The scheme provided £.billion in credit through . million loans. It is not clear how much the Government will recover. But as the banks will get the dud loans refunded by Government – in other words the taxpayer – it is likely other creditors will get priority.  A government source said the average loan was well below £, and the Bounce Back scheme had been a leline to over ,, firms. A spokesman added: “Businesses are expected to make every effort to repay loans. Most payments are being made as expected.” The Treasury – blasted by Lord Agnew as “having no knowledge or little interest” in fraud – has written off £.billion in Covid scams. title: couple aged 50 60 spend
story: Couple aged  and  spend £, to have their baby togetherSharon Kollmar, , admitted people "couldnt understand" why she wanted to have a baby at the age of  with her -year-old fiancé, Gus, who is already a granddad-of-threeSharon was desperate for another baby and defies those who suggest shes too old Image: @sharonkollmar   CATERS NEWSByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments A mum who has given birth at -years-old admitted people thought she was crazy for spending £, to have a baby with her -year-old fiancé. Sharon Kollmar, from Long Island, New York, claims she was desperate to extend her family and have a baby with her fiance, Gus, , who is already a granddad. Sharon, , already has an -year-old son, Aiden, from a previous relationship, but always wanted more kids.After almost a decade of being single, she had started to look into sperm donors. But while explaining her quest to lelong friend and now fiancé, Gus, he suggested that the pair should strike up a relationship and try for a baby together. They ended up having to spend £,on an egg donor and IVF - they welcomed their daughter, Bayleigh Emerson, in September . Sharon said: I so desperately wanted more kids. People thought I was crazy for wanting to start all over again. Iaposd been to see fertility doctors who were dismissive because of my age and told me that although I still had eggs, the chances of me falling pregnant were slim. I was also still single. I was talking to my male friend about everything and out of the blue he said aposwhat about me apos Iaposd never even thought about it before but it seemed like a great idea. He had always been in my and my sonaposs le. So we started dating, and because I was around  and he was , we started trying to conceive straight away. We were trying for two years and hadnapost fallen pregnant, so we looked into donor embryos but the cut off age was . So we turned to donor eggs and found someone who matched my colourings and had fresh eggs, rather than frozen. The process cost us , and I went through rigorous physical testing and preparation. In January , when Sharon was , she underwent the embryo transfer which was successful on the first attempt. When she finally received the doctoraposs call confirming she was pregnant, she says it was the moment she had been waiting for for over a decade. Sharon and Gus, who is already a dad to his -year-old daughter and grandfather to her three children, welcomed their new addition on September , .Sharon added: My pregnancy was pretty textbook, although the baby was bigger this time around so I felt it a little more.But I love being pregnant. People couldnapost understand why we would want another baby at the age of  and . My friendsapos kids were graduating college and getting married. Some of my friends were even grandparents. Gus is even a grandfather and his daughter is . His grandkids are ,  and . So people had a hard time getting their head around it, but it meant the world to us. Sharon gave birth via C-section as there was meconium in her fluids and baby Bayleigh had flipped over out of the ideal delivery position. Sharon claims doctors also incorrectly predicted she would weigh lbs but she was born at a healthy lbs z. She said: Holding her in my arms was incredible. I love having a newborn. It is just as rewarding and satisfying as the first time. I think people thought I would regret it, but I would not change it for the world. When we brought her home and I placed her in my sonaposs arms, his eyes filled with tears and he told her that he had been waiting for her his entire le. It was so special. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Sharon and Gus still have four frozen embryos and love the idea of having another baby together. Sharon added: I want to give hope to people who thought their chance at parenthood was over. You need to have faith and live your own le, and not what your family and friends expect you to do. Just because you are a bit older, it doesnapost mean the door is shut.  People said was that it wasnapost fair to bring a child into the world at our age because we likely wouldnapost be alive to see them into adulthood or that weaposd be an embarrassment as old parents. But itaposs better to be born to old parents than not at all, and there is no guarantee that a -year-old that has a baby will see that child into adulthood as illnesses and accidents happen all the time. I always knew that I was going to have more children, even though I wasnapost sure how but I just knew that somehow it would all piece together and it has. I couldnapost be happier. news weird-news car-button-de-ices-windscreen-"Driving tip: How to defrost your windscreenByZahna EklundAudience writerLuke Chillingsworth:,  Jan |commentsWe all know how unforgiving the icy winter months can be, and for those of us that drive, scraping the ice off of your car windscreen in the early hours of the morning can be a real chore. But thanks to a tip from a driving school TikTok account named Driving Test Success @drivingtestsuccess, we no longer need to suffer in the freezing cold before we head to work, as it turns out you can actually get rid of the ice from inside your car as itaposs warming up. Experts at Driving Test Success say you can clear ice cover by simply activating your car windscreen fan, which will heat up the glass from the inside and help to melt the frost, the Express reports. In the companyaposs video, they explained: “Frozen windscreen  Put the temperature on high.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. “Put the front windscreen fan on max. The ice will start to melt from the heat. Wipe away excess water andthe fan to normal. While the tip might seem obvious to some seasoned drivers, several commenters on the video who were new to driving couldnapost believe theyaposd never seen the hack before. One commenter said: Wow, magic! The ice is gone. And another praised the account for all their help, as they wrote: Iaposve learnt so much thanks to your app!  But others were less impressed, as one TikTok user shunned the idea, stating: Wastes more fuel. Just get [out] and scrape it off you lazy so and so.” Driving Test Success is far from the first account to point out the easy de-icing trick either, as another video online from Clear View Driving said road users should use their demister before they start driving. They said: “Now donapost use your windscreen wipers or washers as that wonapost help. Turn on your front and rear demister. “The rear demister also heats up your side mirrors in most new cars. Butthe mirrors are not clear, make sure to clear them before you start driving. “Then, once itaposs done you can use your wipers.” And in the cold winter months, the AA has also encouraged road users to “turn on the warm air blower” and “heated mirrors” to clear frost cover quickly and safely.They explained: “Start the engine and turn on the warm air blower on the windscreen. Switch on the rear windscreen heater and heated mirrors,you have them. Turn on the air-con. Itaposs not just for summer – itaposll remove moisture from the air to stop the car from misting up. “Don’t use your hands to wipe misted-up windows – youaposll leave greasy smears and a diamond ring could scratch the glass. Use a lint-free absorbent clothnecessary. “Stay with your car the whole time while the engineaposs running.” What do you think is the best way to de-ice your car  Let us know in the comments below. news weird-news man-eating-raw-meat--"Im only eating raw meat for  days to seeI dieByVerity Sulway:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |comments While some of us have been attempting veganuary, and more people than ever are turning to veggie meals in a bid to help the planet and save animals - one Instagram user has gone in the opposite direction.A US man has shockingly challenged himself to eat raw meat alone for  days to find out whether or not he will survive. He previously ate a plant-based diet but claimed to suffer from health issues because of it. So instead, heaposs been training his stomach to digest nothing but uncooked meat, including organs and he washes it down with raw animal milk and raw eggs. He claims his favourite meals include chicken breast, steak and swordfish and so far heaposs managed to avoid severe food poisoning. But worryingly he is risking contracting E. coli, salmonella and Shigella.Getthe newsyou want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.He also faces further health issueshe fails to eat fruit and vegetables, including constipation, haemorrhoids and even scurvy.Posting stomach-churning photos of himself biting into raw flesh, the man has amassed a following online as they wait to see the effects of his bizarre diet. His Instagram page @therawmeatexperiment has .k followers, and the bio explains: Eating raw meat at Whole Foods every day until I die from bacteria SeeingI Live for  days or  years.  His aposcavemanapos diet has also seen him tuck into cow liver and camel milk and tearing into a steak with his teeth. No chewing involved, you can basically just place the cow flesh in your mouth and swallow it, he explained. Pretty tasty, half the cost of a steak, will probably be a weekly meal along with cod. Asked by a follower how he was feeling, he confirmed: Good, I like it so far and feel no reason to stop, no crazy changes either way though. On his th day, he revealed he was able to eat lb of mince in just five minutes - one of his favourites.  A brick of shredded cow and milk of the sheep. Ground beef has become my favourite meal, he said. Due to the low cost, ease of consuming a pound in like  minutes, gathering  calories of absorbable cow and digesting perfectly. He admitted cooked meat tastes a bit better though the raw stuff was growing on him. On day  he ate raw bacon, which one of his followers said looked like a skinned foot. For those concerned about how limited his diet is, he has explained he does occasionally eat potatoes, rice and cooked chicken. And heaposs claimed his pain has gone away since embarking on his new carnivorous diet. When I started eating steak and eggs for breakfast, instead of bagels and smoothies, I felt full for most of the day, and stable, instead of getting dizzy from a carb crash, my pain started to go away, he insisted. But doctors generally warn that eating a lot of raw meat is dangerousyou canapost be sure of the quality and what bacteria might be lurking beneath.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: mans creative job application method
story: Mans creative job application method gets the entire office talking about himJonathan Swt decided to think outside the box when he applied for a job on Instantprints marketing team - and his creative method has become the talk of the officeHis application got people talking ByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Jan |commentsWhen it comes to landing your dream career, you sometimes need to go above and beyond to land that all-important interview, and thinking outside of the box is definitely encouraged. One man who made sure he would stand out from the crowd was Jonathan Swt, who saw an opening for a position within the marketing department of Yorkshire-based printing specialists, Instantprint and decided to get creative with his application. The -year-old made his mark by recycling the companyaposs own flyers in a genius marketing stunt in the company car park - as he placed a flyer advertising his LinkedIn profile on every single car.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Marketing Manager Craig Wassell, who was doing the hiring for the position, noticed Jonathanaposs antics on CCTV when he was advised by security to take a closer look at what was going on. And he was so impressed that he decided to invite the man in for an interview. He said: When I looked out of the office window, I could already see that someone had been around leaving flyers on all the car windscreens, and upon closer inspection, it became apparent that the flyers more closely were, in fact, an application for the role I was hiring for. Naturally, we immediately invited Jonathan in for an interview. Craig also shared footage from the CCTV cameras, as well as a picture of the cars, on Twitter - where he admitted Jonathan has become the talk of the office thanks to his stunt. He wrote: We’ve been well and truly ‘flyered’ by a candidate applying for a #job in our marketing team. Every car in the car park is covered in flyers linking to the applicant’s LinkedIn profile! That’s definitely one way to stand out. He’s been the talk of the office since covering everyoneaposs cars in CVs. I love it when we get a #creativejobapplication. Instantprint received over  applications for the position, but thanks to Jonathanaposs stroke of creative genius, he became the lucky candidate to be offered the role and started his new job earlier this month. Craig added: “Jonathan’s application did more than grab my attention. It showed that he’d researched the brand and that he had the right attitude, creativity and sense of humour to fit the team perfectly. I can’t wait to see what ideas he brings to the table and to work with him in the future.” But Jonathan has admitted he canapost completely take credit for the idea, as he was inspired by a similar Instantprint employee who had bagged a position on the design team after having her photograph printed on the companyaposs roller banners. He said: “I remembered seeing Instantprint in the news a while back because a candidate had successfully applied for a design role by having her photograph printed on one of the company’s own roller banners, and thought ‘what a great idea!’ “I wanted my application to make a statement just like that one had and what better way than distributing  flyers with my face on around the company car park ” Have you got a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: mum slammed bringing uninvited child
story: Mum slammed for bringing uninvited child to birthday parties and demanding foodA mum has sparked debate for bringing her other, uninvited child to a birthday party and demanding they are fed and get party gts - sometimes not even leaving enough for the other kidsA mum has everyone furious after she brought her older child to parties he wasnt invited toImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByVerity Sulway:,  Jan |commentsAn uninvited party guest is always an awkward situation. But what do you do when said guest is a child A stressed-out mum has vented her frustration online after throwing parties for her own child.The mum of one of the childaposs friends brings her kid along to the party - but also has their older sibling in tow.The older sibling demands lunch and party gts, sometimes leaving not enough for the children who were actually invited.The mum is desperate for this to stop, but she doesnapost know how to say it without things becoming very awkward. Getthe newsyou want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Taking to Mumsnet, the woman wrote: Now I know some people have to bring siblings and ask in advance. However, I know this person doesnapost ask, as they brought their older sibling to my childaposs party a few weeks ago and didnapost ask.I had made packed lunches, so I didnapost have extra boxes. In fact, they didnapost even say when arriving. The very rude child then demanded lunch and a party bag, the mum was oblivious and today was style same. She continued: Today this sibling who is at least  years older than the birthday child took prizes when not enough for the actual friends of the birthday girl. AIBU, or should I and all parties over cater for everyone to bring siblings  A debate ensued in the comment section as other parents flocked to give their opinions.  One wrote: Extremely rude behaviour. Whoever is hosting should say they canapost stay at that start, wrote another. A third added: I hate this new thing of siblings coming to parties. It p****s me right off. Yes, I understand they might have to be there to drop off and the parent not able to stay for the party but that is preferable that an uninvited guest just coming. Parents wouldnapost do it at any other invite so donapost do it at a kids party. If we wanted siblings there we would state it on the invite. If not donapost go or say you will have to drop and go as you have no childcare for sibling. Donapost just invite whoever you want to someone aposs party. A fourth demanded: Why wouldn’t you just say something to the mum  More fool the people who just allow it. Another penned: I’ve had this too, I ran out of party bags for DC’s friends because of unexpected siblings taking them. Lesson learnt and they are kept hidden until going home time. People still bring siblings without asking. It’s annoying, especially when the activity isn’t suitable for their ages. I now put on the invite a message about no siblings. People still show up with them!Do you think parents should be banned from bringing their other children to birthday parties  Let us know in the comments.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ParentingBirthday partyViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: madeleine mccann no1 suspect swapped
story: Exclusive: Madeleine McCann No. suspect swapped child abuse images with undertakerChristian Brueckner, the prime suspect in the disappearance of Madeleine McCann, swapped child abuse images with an undertaker. The mortician gave a full confession when quizzed by copsMadeleine McCann disappeared in Praia da Luz, Portugal on May ,  Image: METROPOLITAN POLICE AFP via GettByJon ClarkePatrick HillNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan The prime suspect in the Madeleine McCann case swapped child abuse images and depraved online messages with an undertaker. The mortician gave “a full confession” when quizzed by German police and admitted he was a “regular customer” of convicted paedophile Christian Brueckner. It is understood material he handed over to officers now forms part of evidence being used against Brueckner. The undertaker, also a convicted sex offender, cannot be named for legal reasons – but he has spoken to the makers of a new documentary about the case, being shown tomorrow night on German TV channel Sat.. The film’s lead investigator Jutta Rabe told the Sunday People: “I’m not sure what he paid but he confirmed they regularly swapped material, all of which he has handed over to detectives.  “We haven’t been able to confirmthey were business partners but he insisted he... has completely mended his ways.” The undertaker, who lives alone, said he was interviewed by the BKA – Germany’s FBI. Miss Rabe said: “He was given a choice, ‘You either admit it and help us then go into therapy or go to prison’. He chose co-operation.” She added: “He is terried of being attacked and horried of his family finding out.” Madeleine, three, vanished from an Algarve apartment in  while on holiday with her twin siblings and parents Kate and Gerry, of Rothley, Leics. In , Brueckner shared a string of sick messages with the undertaker, including some about snatching and imprisoning a toddler. Brueckner talks about making films to “document exactly how she is tormented”. The horrying Skype conversation was found when Brueckner was arrested for molesting his girlfriend’s daughter. He is now behind bars for offences including the  rape of a US widow in Praia da Luz – where Madeleine vanished two years later. German prosecutors say they have “concrete” evidence against him – and he is their only suspect in Madeleine’s case. But they also fear Breuckner has committed at least five other sex crimes, including the rape of an Irish woman, who was attacked in her Portuguese apartment in . The film reveals German police made a huge breakthrough when they unearthed a “partial fingerprint” of Breuckner’s which was found in the Irish victim’s flat. In the documentary, German prosecutor Hans Christian Wolters says he expects Brueckner to be charged with some of the crimes “imminently”. title: north korea launches seventh missile
story: North Korea launches seventh missile in just one month in aggressive show of forceKim Jong-un’s North Korea army launched the ballistic missile as the number of tests reached seven for the month of January - making it the busiest month on record for the stateKim Jong-un’s North Korea army launched the ballistic missile Image: EyePress News REX ShutterstockByDouglas Patient:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan |commentsNorth Korea has launched yet another ballistic missile as the number of tests reaches seven this month - which is sure to cause tension across the world.Kim Jong-un’s hermit kingdom army launched the weapon into the sea off its east coast at around .am local timeon Sunday. It’s the nuclear-armed countryaposs seventh test this month which is a record for the state. The Japanese government said North Korea had launched a possible ballistic missile, while South Koreaaposs Joint Chiefs of Staff reported the launch of an unidentied projectile. The ballistic missile launch and the ones before it are a threat to our country, the region and the international community, Japanese government spokesperson Chief Cabinet Secretary Hirokazu Matsuno told a televised briefing.  This series of launches violate UN resolutions and we strongly protest this action by North Korea. Matsuno said thatthe projectile was a standard ballistic missile it is estimated to have reached an altitude of ,km, flown for  minutes, to a distance of km. It makes January the busiest ever for North Koreaaposs missile programme. Analysts say the country’s weapon tests are increasing and developing new capabilities despite strict sanctions and United Nations Security Council resolutions that ban the countryaposs ballistic missile tests. In an address ahead of the New Year, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called for bolstering the military with cutting edge technology at a time when talks with South Korea and the United States have stalled.  Since then, North Korea has conducted a series of launches displaying a dizzying array of weapon types, launch locations, and increasing sophistication. From hypersonic missiles and long-range cruise missiles to missiles launched from railcars and airports, the tests highlight the nuclear-armed stateaposs rapidly expanding and advancing arsenal amid stalled denuclearisation talks. North Korea has not tested its longest-range intercontinental ballistic missiles or nuclear weapons since , but the countryaposs rulers suggested this month they could restart those activities.  Its latest launches included a test of two short-range ballistic missiles and their warheads on Thursday, and an update to a long-range cruise missile system was tested on Tuesday. The tests appear aimed at bolstering national pride ahead of several major North Korean holidays and sending a message of strength, said Le-Eric Easley, a professor of international studies at Ewha University in Seoul.The Kim regime hears external discussions of its domestic weaknesses and sees South Koreaaposs growing strength, he said.So it wants to remind Washington and Seoul that trying to topple it would be too costly. Pyongyang has defended the launches as its sovereign right of self defence. It says they are not directed at any specic country, but accused Washington and Seoul of having hostile policies”. Kim visited a munitions factory last week, where he called for an all-out drive to produce powerful cutting-edge arms”. He touted his devotion to smashing ... the challenges of the US imperialists and their vassal forces seeking to violate their right to self-defence, calling it the harshest-ever adversity”. title: parents forget baby supermarket drive
story: Parents forget baby at supermarket and drive home - as shopper finds him in trolleyA shopper was left gobsmacked after coming across a baby boy in a supermarket shopping trolley all by himself - after his parents reportedly made a massive mistakeThe baby was found in a trolley Image: NEWSFLASHByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Jan |commentsWhile out grocery shopping, customers at a store were left stunned by an unexpected find in a supermarket trolley.An unnamed shopper and several others came across a four-month-old baby boy sitting in a car seat in a trolley, with his parents seemingly nowhere in sight. As reported by The Sun, the childaposs parents had managed to drive home with their shopping before realising that they had forgotten the little boy.Locals found the tot at a supermarket in Lages, Brazil and were quick to inform security guards and the police.One shopper recorded the incident and in the clip, they could be heard asking the baby where his forgetful parents are. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.They said: Have they left you here  Iaposve called security. Where are your mummy and daddy  Where  Where are your forgetful mother and father  When police arrived at the scene, the babyaposs parents had ed and they told officers how they had left the store, put their groceries into the car and drove home without putting their son in the vehicle as well. They added that they rushed back to the supermarket car park when they realised what they had done. Police officers concluded that the pair had suffered enough and decided not to take any further action against them. Thankfully the baby boy was fine and was filmed smiling by those who found him - despite being left on his own for a little while. Fort Atacadista, the supermarket company where the incident occurred, shared the following statement regarding the debacle: In a few minutes everything went back to normal and was resolved.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it.
